thread.title: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley's appeal delayed, eligible for rest NLDS, per report
thread.title_full: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley's appeal delayed, eligible for rest NLDS, per report

author: Ryan Hatch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley's appeal delayed, eligible for rest NLDS, per report
text:
RELATED : 'We want Utley!' Mets prove Citi Field can rock in October with win over Dodgers | Politi 
The Los Angeles Times ' Bill Shaikin reported Tuesday afternoon that Utley, who was suspended for two games by Major League Baseball after sliding into Mets ' shortstop Ruben Tejada and breaking his leg last weekend, is eligible to play through the rest of the series because his appeal hearing (filed immediately) to the suspension will be heard October 19. Source: Chase Utley's appeal hearing has been scheduled for next Monday (Oct. 19). â€” Bill Shaikin (@BillShaikin) October 13, 2015 
The Mets and Dodgers play Game 4 Tuesday night in New York, the Mets leading the series, 2-1. If the Dodgers win, Game 5 will be Thursday in L.A., but that will still be four days shy of the appeal date. The appeal hearing will only affect Utley if the Dodgers make it to the NLCS. Mets fans react when Dodgers Chase Utley introduced at Citi Field The capacity crowd at Citi Field reacts to Chase Utley when he is introduced with the rest of the Los Angeles Dodgers for Game 3 of the National League Divisional Series. 
Utley did not play Monday night in Game 3 even though he was eligible. The former Philadelphia Phillies ' second baseman was showered with boos during introductions Monday night at Citi Field. 
Tejada, who is out for the rest of the postseason, was welcome to thunderous applause as he stepped on the field in a leg cast.
